channel.title: Matrixdist on gzt does statistics
channel.description: Recent content in Matrixdist on gzt does statistics

item.title: Matrixdist News
item.description: I have just finished setting up handling for AR(1) and compound symmetry variance structures in my maximum likelihood estimation function for matrix variate normal distributions in matrixdist. This means I may submit it to CRAN soon (itâ€™s currently available on github). An example: library(matrixdist) A <- rmatrixnorm(100, mean=array(0,dim=c(3,4)), U = toeplitz(c(1,.8,.64)), V = rWishart(1,7,diag(4))[,,1]) mle.matrixnorm(A, row.variance="AR(1)") ## $mean ## [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4] ## [1,] 0.23784768 0.03615944 0.05471075 0.06021446 ## [2,] 0.
